intro: Eleutherococcus evodiifolius, commonly known as Siberian ginseng, is a deciduous shrub native to the forests of eastern Asia. It features compound leaves with 5 to 11 elliptical leaflets, which are dark green and leathery in texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in temperate regions. Its adaptability and medicinal properties have made it a subject of interest in herbal medicine.
